title: Clustering logarithms up to six loops
abstract:
We compute the leading clustering (abelian non-global) logarithms, which
arise in the distribution of non-global QCD observables when final-state
partons are clustered using the $k_t$ jet algorithm, up to six loops in
perturbation theory. Our calculations are based on the recently introduced
formula for the analytic structure of $k_t$ clustering [1]. These logarithms
exhibit a pattern of exponentiation and are subsequently resummed into an
exponential form. We compare this resummed result with all-orders numerical
calculations. Additionally, we enhance the analytical distribution using
techniques from the study of non-abelian non-global logarithms, particularly
through the application of conformal transformations.
